result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Kobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
$450.00 restitution to be paid to Probation while on Probation on behalf of the Polk County Sheriff Department.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. Cannot hold elected office.
Must stay sober. Must abstain from all alcohol and drugs unless prescribed by doctor and must take only as prescribed.

supervisions.notes:
Must follow all rules of Probation. Must complete all treatment and assessments recommended by Probation.
Concurrent with: 05CF138

Defendant Scott A Kobs in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JB-clerk 1:38pm        
CASES: 14CF392/393. CT rec original PQWR. No corr/add to PSI. Sentence Credit 312 days. CT recs EX 1-5 (letters). Off the record 2:54pm   Back on the record 3:13pm
SENTENCE:
14CF392: CT 1: 3 yrs - 1 yr 6 mo IC and 1 yr 6 mo ES - concurrent to ES currently on 05CF138 - 312 days credit - rules as recom by dept - complete all treatment and assessments recommended by dept, have to stay sober, abstain from all alcohol and drugs unless prescribed by and use only as prescribed, all costs, no firearms, no voting, no public office, $450.00 restitution to SD.

14CF393: CT 2: I/S 10 yr - 5 yrs IC and 5 yrs ES - prob for 10 yrs concurrent with 14CF392 and concurrent with 05CF138, if revoked entitled to 312 days credit, have to stay sober, rules as recommended by dept, complete all treatment and assessments recommended by dept, abstain from all alcohol and drugs unless prescribed by and use only as prescribed, all costs, no firearms, no voting, no public office, elg for SAP, not elg for CIP. 

Must report to PCJ by 4:30pm today.

2 Cases: 14CF392 & 14CF393 11:43 Defendant Scott A Kobs in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant Scott A Kobs in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk   DE agrees to do hearing by telephone.  Ct goes over PQW.   14CF393 - DE pleads G.  14CF392 amend to  961.41(3g)(g).   Ct grants motion to amend in 14CF392 as set forth in previous stat.
